subject: Public Speaking
title: Glossophobia: The Fear with a Name
description: A micro-lesson that makes Glossophobia: The Fear with a Name usable.

hook.text: Surveys consistently rank public speaking above death as a top fear. Jerry Seinfeld had a famous joke about it.

buildup.text: Glossophobia affects roughly 75% of people to some degree. It's one of the most common phobias on earth.

discovery.text: The fear isn't about speaking itself. It's about being judged, rejected, or humiliated by a group.

twist.text: Introverts and extroverts get stage fright at similar rates. Personality type doesn't protect you.

climax.text: Glossophobia is so common because it taps into a primal social fear: being cast out of the group.

punchline.text: We fear the podium because we fear the tribe.
